H0.text: What name is given to a piece of land assigned as part of a clergyman's living. Manor

H1.text: What name is given to a piece of land assigned as part of a clergyman's living. Benefice

H2.text: What name is given to a piece of land assigned as part of a clergyman's living. Vicarage

H3.text: What name is given to a piece of land assigned as part of a clergyman's living. Glebe

A4.text: A glebe is an area of land within an ecclesiastical parish used to support a parish priest.

A5.text: In the Roman Catholic, Anglican and Presbyterian traditions, a glebe is land belonging to a benefice

A6.text: In many villages in England, the former clergy house is called the 'Old Vicarage' or the 'Old Rectory'.
